solution_line_template: Over {num_floors_next_segment} of the floors, it takes the elevator {num_floors_next_segment} floors * {minutes_per_floor_next_segment} minutes per floor = <<{num_floors_next_segment}*{minutes_per_floor_next_segment}={time_next_segment}>>{time_next_segment} minutes to lower.

Over the final {num_floors_final_segment} floors, it takes the elevator {num_floors_final_segment} floors * {minutes_per_floor_final_segment} minutes per floor = <<{num_floors_final_segment}*{minutes_per_floor_final_segment}={time_final_segment}>>{time_final_segment} minutes to lower.

So in total, the elevator takes {time_first_half} minutes in the first half + {time_next_segment} minutes in the next five floors + {time_final_segment} minutes in the final five floors = <<{time_first_half}+{time_next_segment}+{time_final_segment}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes to lower to the bottom.
This is the same as {total_minutes} minutes / {minutes_per_hour} minutes per hour = <<{total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours.
